description.narrative: 2.3. Children in selected primary schools have access to inclusive education models that enable them to improve their learning outcomes., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, education inequity gaps are reduced and children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from quality and inclusive education, which provides better opportunities for their development.

description.narrative: In 2019 UNICEF continued to contribute to national inclusive compulsory education policies through knowledge generation and technical assistance in key educational agenda fields advocating for equity, quality education and learning outcomes. Key local agenda addressed: inclusive education, Integral Sexual Education and primary and secondary students' trajectories and learning outcomes through targeted program. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019
